intro: Cerastium velenovskyi, commonly known as the Velenovsky's mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features small, hairy leaves and produces clusters of white or pink flowers in early summer. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
